content.title: Intro
content.content: -në is a Quenya suffix that has two meanings.

content.title: -në1
content.content:
Used for denoting a set of something.

Examples
carcanë = "row of teeth" (carca = "tooth"|KARAK)

content.title: -në2
content.content:
Evidently a nominal counterpart of the adjectival ending -na.

Examples
carnë = "(round) loaf" (carna = "round"| KOR)[1]
sarnë = "strong place" (sarna = "of stone"| SAR?)

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, Christopher Tolkien (ed.), The Book of Lost Tales Part One, Appendix: Names in the Lost Tales – Part I, p.257
